DOC.detailed_description: This longitudinal study evaluate subjective behavioral outcome previous randomize control study ( RCT ) rTMS/CIT ( Pediatric Hemiparesis : Synergistic Treatment use rTMS CIT ( NIH Grant Number : 1RC1HD063838-01 ; PI : Dr. James Carey ) . The previous rTMS/CIT study evaluate safety efficacy 5 treatment 6-Hz prim low-frequency rTMS apply non-stroke hemisphere combine constraint induce therapy ( CIT ) promote recovery paretic hand child adolescent . CIT show improved behavioral outcome well cortical reorganization representation affect limb . The previous RCT rTMS-Sham/CIT study design ( real rTMS n=10 sham rTMS n=9 ) . Our research question , 'What medical status perception previous participant concern involvement intensive rTMS/CIT RCT specific symptom monitoring , TMS experience , current functional status ' .
